attributes.action: Call a General Election for after the Conservative Leadership Election.
attributes.additional_details:
In the 2015 General Election, the Conservative Party was called upon to form a majority government in the House of Commons. This was under the the pre-text of a United Kingdom in the European Union, and David Cameron as the Conservative Leaser. From October, these essential factors cease to exit. 

The electorate should vote for the government they want to lead exit talks and run the countries affairs in this new political context. This will allow the Government to have a democratic mandate.
attributes.background:
After the EU Referendum on 23rd June 2016, and David Cameron's resignation, the mandate from 2015 of the current Conservative Government ceases to exit. 

I call upon the Government to call an election so the electorate can democratically elect a new government to lead the EU exit negotiations.
